inn1.comm: full outside off, some gentle swing away from Cook, left alone
this one starts straighter but Cook is again able to leave it alone
he has a half-hearted poke at this one outside off, a length delivery shaping away and it carries low to Dhoni
shapes to cut this, it's quite tight to his body and takes a bottom edge into the pitch then runs into the off side
fuller and a touch wide, 78mph, Cook happy to watch it go through
short of a length, starting on off stump, Cook gets across his crease to try and flick through the leg side but finds mid-on...a gentle maiden to start the day
offers a gentle half volley first up, 82mph, and Hales drives it elegantly between cover and mid-off
pulls the length back just a little, Hales leaves alone rather than having a drive on the up
he goes for another drive, his feet are a little stuck in the crease this time and he's playing away from his body, the ball skews off a thick inside edge past the stumps
good delivery, on off stump, some movement back into Cook which squares him up and takes a thick outside edge along the ground to backward point
too full this time, on the stumps, flicked behind square on the leg side
unconvincing leave, or attempted leave, from Hales this time as he's late withdrawing his bat and it skids off the face towards Dhoni but lands well in front of him
full outside off, Cook comes forward and it runs off the edge towards the fine gully/wide fourth slip
athletic fielding at cover (worth four high-fives from his team-mates) as Cook leans forward into a drive
beaten as this one nibbles past the outside edge, more uncertainty from Cook around off stump
full around off stump, defended towards mid-off
very little timing from Cook, he's offered some width and it's quite short but his cut is intercepted by cover...pitch doesn't appear to have much pace
and again, aims to cut but isn't quite wide enough and it finds cover
full outside off, hint of swing, Hales is forward into a drive and finds cover
width outside off, he frees his arms with a square drive which goes behind point towards third man
full outside off, plinked to mid-off...think Cook's timing may actually be getting worse
gets this one away, but it's more top edge and middle as he throws his hands at a short, wide delivery and it flies high over the slips and fine of third man
back on a good line and length, Cook feeling for it outside off, no footwork and hands miles away from his body
that's better, it was full and quite wide, Cook holds his shape and it comes off somewhere near the middle as he drives powerfully square of the wicket

what a cracker! Excellent delivery, swinging back into Hales from outside off, he's caught in the crease, there's a sizeable gap between bat and pad because he likes to stand on leg stump...the ball cannons it off stump. It was his first real big in-ducker of the day. Clever stuff
pushed across full outside off, left alone
opens the face and runs it to third man
and another! Now Cook's on his way. Almost guiding the ball to the fine gully. The delivery had some width, Cook went for the cut and couldn't have picked out Raina much better. Neat, low catch.
swings down the leg side, clips the pad on the way to Dhoni to dives to his right
on off stump, defended into the on side
in the channel outside off, Ballance pulls his bat inside the line
back of a length on off stump, defended to point
stays back in the crease, defended towards mid-off
loose stroke outside off, wasn't really fully committed to the cut...the ball was there for the shot, but Ballance was half-hearted and was beaten
gets a long way across the stumps and is taken on the pad, a strangled appeal but it pitched outside leg
push and run towards mid-off, good piece of judgement by Ballance who noticed the fielder was a fraction deep
full outside off, swings way further, left alone
same ball, same place, same stroke...plenty of swing for Bhuvneshwar
keeps it hanging outside off stump, Ballance not tempted yet
a touch shorter, he goes for the cut but can't find a gap in the off side as he locates cover
deep the crease, whips a straight delivery down to long leg
full and wide, too wide this time and called
corrects his line, it's short of a length outside off, defended to the covers
sweet stroke, some relief for England as Ballance leans into a full delivery outside off and drives it straight of mid-off
pulls the length back, turned into the leg side towards mid-on
shorter at off stump, Ballance tries another whip into the leg side but again finds mid-on
full and wide, Ballance goes for the drive but doesn't connect. Was hanging back a little on the stroke
short of a length, onto the back foot and times it sweetly to cover
three down! Change of angle works. Full delivery outside off, angled into Ballance who aims to flick into the leg side and gets a leading edge which loops gently to cover
full outside off, left alone
good delivery, tight to off stump, Root played at that although tried to make out he pulled the bat away
leaves this alone outside off
comes forward and drives square to backward point
shorter of length at off stump, defended from the back foot back to the bowler
punched off the back foot into the off side...another maiden for Bhuvneshwar
short ball over off stump, Morgan ducks underneath
fuller delivery on the stumps, Morgan is squared up a little as he defends back to the bowler
worked into the leg side towards midwicket
gets a fraction too straight, glances off the pad wide of Dhoni towards fine leg
that's a good one, just outside off stump, forces Morgan to play and the ball zips past the outside edge. It has been tentative from all the England batsmen
fuller at off stump, Morgan tries to get forward and pushes back towards Shami
comes forward, drives with a slightly open face towards cover
a punchy drive this time, full on middle and off, Root comes forward and places it nicely straight of mid-off
not so full this time, outside off, left alone
forward and drives to mid-off who can cut it off this time
on the back foot, opens the face and chops the delivery to backward point
width this time but he can't take advantage, cutting to backward point...a throw hits the stumps and ricochets away but doesn't cost anything in the end
outside off, cut down to third man
on the pads, worked down to long leg
full outside off, left alone
beaten outside off, Morgan walking into a defensive push and ends up feeling for it away from his body
gets across his crease and defends back to the bowler
tight defence this time, on off stump, played back towards the bowler
edged! But finds the gap between the first slip and third slip although it probably wouldn't have carried to a second slip. Playing away from his body at a length delivery
doesn't go after this one, left alone
shorter, outside off, Root goes for the cut but the lack of pace from the pitch means gets a bottom edge towards third slip where Raina does well to dive across and cut it off
starts straighter, shapes into Root who clips to midwicket
beaten! On the inside edge this time, coming forward to drive and the delivery held its line off the seam
another one past the outside edge, this time an away swinger which Root fiddles without much footwork. The ball barely carries to Dhoni
pushed across outside off, left alone
touch fuller this time, outside off, left alone
comes down the pitch, it's a short-of-a-length delivery which he then flicks behind square on the leg side
back outside off stump, through to the keeper
another one through to the keeper, but that one is too wide outside off
closer to off stump, or at least inside the white marking that is a guide for the wide delivery, left alone again
steps across outside off and defends a length delivery to the covers
neatly played, flicks a straight delivery off the back foot just wide of mid-on but Rayudu makes good ground and pulls out a dive
tight run! Outside off, pushed into the covers, they set off quickly for the single and Morgan had to get a hustle on although would have beaten a direct hit
full outside off, comes forward, defended
left alone outside off
gets well across the crease, exposes all his stumps, and comes at the bowler then drives to mid-off
ends the over with one left through to the keeper
length delivery aimed at the off stump, the batsman punches it to mid on
he presents the straightest of bats to this length delivery, punches it to mid-off
a touch too straight and Root is quick to clip it to deep backward square leg for a couple of runs
a touch slower this time, 115 kph, the batsman comes forward, adjusts to the slower speed before dabbing it towards midwicket
back of length outside off, the batsman rocks back and dabs this to third man for a single
width provided but Morgan misses out, just underestimates the bounce a bit and it fizzes past the outside edge

looks to push this off the back foot and gets an outside edge through the vacant second slip for a quick couple.. The throw from third man is flat and hard and Dhoni deflects it on to the stumps, but Root makes it back just in time
this is punched through the tiny gap at cover, past Ashwin, the slowest of Indian men, and it allows the batsman enough time to get back for an easy couple
back of length on off at 136 kph, the batsman defends it off the back foot
some seam movement outside off, 139 kph, Root leaves it alone
he is staying back and this one seams in, takes the inside edge and raps him on the knee roll
a lot of movement after the ball has passed the batsman, Dhoni has to quickly move to his left to gather that.
pushed through, the batsman shuffles across and defends
slower and on a length, the batsman goes back and pushes it to cover
pushes this wide outside off, allows Morgan space to cut it behind point for a single
tossed up on the off and middle line, whipped straight to midwicket
slower and outside off, Root punches it down the pitch off the back foot
wooo. turn! The batsman gets hit on the top of his knee roll as he comes forward to defend. No appeal as the bounce would have taken it over
he is working up some decent pace, this one is angled across the left-hander at 140kph, left alone
that's a harsh call for a wide! The batsman leaves this through to the keeper.. it was well inside the wide marker on off. Brings up England's 50
corrects the line, but this is on the pads and handsomely punched through midwicket for a boundary. All timing and placement. He didn't try to hit that hard at all

this one is through off side now! It was full and Morgan is quick to come forward and punch it through cover. Rahane dives to his left but is not able to cut it off. Rayudu chases it down with a slide. Well his foot was in contact with the skirting when he flicked the ball.. that's four
back of length and down the leg side, the umpire gives it a close look but doesn't think it's a wide
shortish on the leg stump line, the batsman pulls it down to fine leg
short ball outside off, swinging further away, Root wanted to pull but withdraws his bat at the last moment
pushes this one down the leg side and Dhoni is not able to take it cleanly, the batsmen swap ends with a quick call
tossed up on off, the batsman flicks it to midwicket
he comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
this is wide outside off and Root looks to play  a reverse-paddle but is beaten by the turn and bounce, takes a blow to his chest
he comes forward and punches it down to long on for a single
on the pads this time, Morgan pushes it to midwicket
fuller this time, easily driven down to long on for a single

loud appeal, extended appeal from Jadeja, as this turns in from outside off and turns in to strike the batsman on thigh pad.. in front of off and middle as the batsman was shuffling across. ... just going over
tossed up on off, he pushes it to midwicket
shuffles across and punches the fuller delivery down to long on
floated up to the batsman who drives it to deep cover
tossed up on off, punched down to long on for a single
drifts on to the pads and Root is quick to whip it past midwicket for a couple
he is bowling much slower compared to Jadeja, but this is on the pads, the batsman dabs it to square leg for a single
tossed up on off, the batsman pushes it towards the non-striker
floated wide outside off, drawing the batsman forward.. He pushes it to cover without any timing
goes back to the flatter one and clips it to deep square leg with the turn
tossed up on the middle stump line, Morgan comes forward and eases it to long off
flatter and quicker, Root works it away to deep square leg off the back foot
fires this one on the middle stump line, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
slower and outside off, the batsman dabs it towards point but it's straight to the fielder
he goes deep in the crease and punches it down to long on for a single
here comes his favourite reverse-sweep, but this is much shorter and it turns in to strike his pads before rolling to short third man
he comes forward and pushes to mid-off
goes back and whips it away to deep midwicket for a single
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
tossed up on off, the batsman whips it to deep square leg with the turn
plays the reverse sweep and gets it on the middle but played straight to backward point
now this is smartly played! He comes forward to this tossed up delivery and just chips it over extra cover.. there is no one in the deep to cover that.
the reverse sweep again, this time it's in the gap through backward point for a couple
quicker delivery on the stumps, defended off the front foot
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman punches it down to long on
he shuffles across and drives the full and flighted delivery down the pitch
uses his feet but gets into a tangle as this is turning down the leg side, he manages to flick it past leg slip for another couple
fired on off, the batsman defends it to midwicket
comes forward to defends this one solidly down the pitch
pitches on middle and turns down the leg side
shuffles across and nudges the tossed up delivery to square leg for an easy single
tossed up from round the wicket, the batsman flicks it fine for a quick single
punches towards long-on but the man from midwicket cuts it off
flatter and shorter outside off, he punches it firmly off the back foot but cannot beat cover
goes back and dabs this one to square leg for a single
flatter and quicker on the stumps, punched down to long off for a single
he stays back to this tossed up delivery, whips it off his pads to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, Root comes forward and squeezes it out to deep point
that was not too far from the leg stump! Morgan went for the reverse sweep but makes no contact and the ball spins across him
he shuffles across and pushes it to midwicket
shimmies down the pitch and takes this on the full, punched to long on for a single
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman punches it down to long on
shuffles towards off and pushes this one down to long on
this one is too far down the leg side and Dhoni does well to pad it to the leg side, however, there is enough time for a single
now Root uses the reverse-sweep, swept to deep cover
he goes deep in the crease and punches this down to long on to bring up team's 100
waits in the crease and punches this one to cover
now uses his feet to push this to long on with soft hands
not much room there but Root cuts it late fine on the off side for a quick couple. Raina bowled it with a pause
flatter delivery, punched down the pitch
drifts on to the pads and the batsman nudges it to midwicket for a quick single

oh Morgan has played this straight into the hands of the leg gully fielder! It was turning in and the batsman goes across to whip it straight to Raina, who takes a comfortable catch. That fielder has been there all summer and this is the first time I have seen him take a catch. Raina can't do anything wrong in the field, can he?
slower and tossed up on off, the batsman drives it to cover
flatter and outside off, the batsman defends it down the pitch
slower and floated up to the batsman, Buttler defends
fires in the yorker on the toes, the batsman is able to dig it out to mid on
tossed up on off, the batsman drives it straight back to the bowler
he draws him forward with a loopy one, driven to cover
looks to reverse paddle this wide delivery but makes no contact
flatter on the stumps, the batsman works it away to deep square leg with the turn
he goes deep in the crease and nudges this to midwicket
stays back to this flatter one and punches it back to the bowler
round the wicket, on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
a shorter delivery, driven off the back foot to deep cover
comes forward and pushes towards mid-off who is deep
opens the face to try and find space in the off side but can't beat cover
fuller, Root flicks it down to long-on with plenty of bottom hand
a flat-batted drive down to long-off
tucked off the pads into midwicket
onto the back foot and driven to cover
pushed down the ground to long-off
dabbed into the off side
shorter delivery, onto the back and pulled down to long-on
worked off the pads, behind square on the leg side
full outside off, driven down to long-off
flicked along the ground to midwicket
a deft reverse from outside off stump, dabbed fine of short fine-leg
played off the back foot to cover

another wicket to a sweep! A reverse one, this time. The ball was outside off, Root couldn't keep the ball down - although not sure if he was actually trying to - it comes off a top edge and loops to short third man. Awful timing for England. And the field was set for the reverse sweep
round the wicket, full on the stumps, driven down the ground
outside off, opens the face behind point on the off side
full on the stumps, hint of movement into Buttler, worked through midwicket
flicked away from middle and leg to midwicket
ooh, and that wasn't far away from him and backward point...wide outside off, Moeen flays his hands through a drive and it was in the air between the two fielders
defended to the off side
back of a length outside off, defends with an open face to backward point
short on leg stump, placed nicely through the leg side with a bottom-handed flick and he has time for a second
played to the off side
uses his feet and pushes down the ground to long-off
dragged down short but Buttler can't take advantage as the ball stops in the surface and he pulls to midwicket
tucked off his pads behind square
touch short outside off, cut out to the cover sweeper
terrific stroke, offered some width outside off and he unleashes an on-the-up cover drive which goes over the off-side ring and well wide of the sweeper
switches to around the wicket, full outside off, another flowing cover drive, this time along the ground, and the sweeper can scoot around the rope
slower ball outside off, 71mph, dabbed behind square with an open face
over the wicket to the right hander, on off stump, Buttler opens the face to third man
round the wicket, full outside off, this time the drive isn't timed very well and dribbles to mid-off
another slower ball, Moeen guides it through the gully area
round the wicket, full on middle, blocked
tight run! Hint of turn, Moeen places it into the off side with a turn of the wrists, Buttler has to get his skates on but the underarm flick from cover has little power
tucked into the leg side
comes down the pitch but isn't to the pitch so defends
he's looked as confident as any England batsman today, he rocks back to a short delivery, uses the crease very well, and pulls it well over the deep square-leg boundary. First six of the innings.
quicker and flatter, turned into the leg side
taken from outside off along the ground to midwicket
shorter delivery on leg stump, gets inside the line and works it backward of square on the leg side...Dhoni not happy the fielder allowed a second
now he sweeps firmly from outside off, rolls his wrists to keep it along the deck and comfortably beats the deep backward square
comes round the wicket, takes the pad into the leg side
on off stump, comes forward and places it into the covers
worked from outside off into square leg, Moeen getting across his crease
continues to use the crease well, staying deep and works this through midwicket
round the wicket to the right hander, Buttler tucks it from around off stump into the leg side
clean and straight! Moeen playing a little gem at the moment. Uses his feet and strikes through the line of the ball, lofting the ball into the stands over long-on
fuller, quicker, driven to cover
connects with another strong sweep to a full delivery, nearly hit it too well as it went just one bounce to deep square
beaten outside off as this one skids through to defeat Buttler's cut
he keeps hitting them cleanly, it's short outside off from round the wicket and Moeen pulls through straight midwicket
fuller this time, smart batting as he opens the face and places it behind point

he's done it! Shami does the trick. Massive blow. It was a length delivery, just nips back off the seam, takes Buttler above the knee roll. Paul Reiffel gives the decision. Hawk Eye says it was going over, by a fair distance
full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
tight line, defended carefully back down the pitch
flatter on the stumps, punched down to long on easily
slower and loopy outside off, Woakes pushes it down the pitch
goes deep in the crease but can only push it down the pitch as it turns into him
uses his feet and pushes this one down to long on
flatter and straight on off, not much space for Moeen. He defends
slower on the middle stump, punched down to long on
flatter and on the stumps, the batsman works it away through midwicket
short and outside off, the batsman misses out, nudges it straight to midwicket
fuller and on the pads, he whips it past midwicket for a couple of runs
he waits on the back foot and punches it down to long off
looks to wrist this flatter delivery away to long on but can't beat Jadeja
comes forward and flicks it away to deep midwicket
fuller delivery on the stumps, driven down to long on for a single
he uses his feet and whips the turning delivery to deep backward square leg with the turn
long hop! This is walloped over midwicket with a mow to bring up the first half-century by an English player this series
comes forward and works this one away to deep midwicket with a single
goes on the back foot and punches this flatter delivery to cover
he reaches out to this tossed up delivery and chips it over midwicket for a couple of runs to the deep
he uses his wrists to work this away to long on for a single
he come forward and defends this quicker delivery down the pitch
reaches out and drives it to long off for a single
comes down the pitch and nudges this flatter delivery towards mid-on for a single
he leans forward and eases this to long on for a single
this was asking to be hit too, short but it cramps the batsman for room as it turns in, Moeen drags it down to deep backward square leg
he keeps stroking them along! Ashwin tosses this a bit too much and the batsman takes it on the full to sweep it powerfully behind square on the leg side
he comes forward and pushes this calmly through cover for a single
flatter and on the stumps, the batsman pushes it straight to midwicket
dropped chance! It was punched to the bowler's right and Ashwin only got a hand to it on the dive.. A lighter, leaner man would have gobbled it up
he whips this through midwicket for a single
Woakes can keep running away to the pavilion! It is Raina again! Moeen cuts it fine to short third man and Raina charges in to hit the stumps direct. How can one man be everywhere?
fires this one on the blockhole, Moeen digs it out down the pitch
he plays a pleasing punch down the ground to get off the mark, a single to long on
fuller on off, Moeen whips it with his steely wrists to deep midwicket

both batsmen are almost at the same end and Shami misses the throw at non-stiker's! It was a short one and the batsman fended it to the leg side.. Moeen was down the pitch all the way and Finn took ages to start.. Shami gets to the ball, has light years of time but aims at long on instead
fuller on the stumps, punched down the ground to long on
that was honing in on the middle stump with a bit of inswing, somehow Finn gets his bat down in time and jams it out
he comes down the pitch and makes room too, drives this inside out but finds Kohli at cover
fired on the pads, the batsman whips it to deep midwicket to bring up team's 200
he waits on the back foot and defends it to midwicket
another direct hit, this time from Shami at short third man, but Moeen slid his bat in time
he makes room and too much room! Misses this quicker one and loses his middle stump. He was trying to go inside out
pushes this one too far down the leg side
reverse sweep from Anderson, pings the man at short third man
quicker delivery on off, the batsman defends
only a bit of turn but that opens the batsman up completely! Misses the top of middle stump as Finn plays inside the line
slower this time, and it takes down the off stump! Finn was aiming for the Birmingham University with a slog sweep, can't say he succeeded.
fires this on the block hole, Gurney digs it out to cover
quicker one again, he gets off the mark with a push to long off
he drives it down the pitch to the bowler, who lobs the ball up in the air much to delight of the crowd
pushes this one wide outside off but the batsman misses out on the cut shot, beaten
full and wide again, and the batsman misses it one more time
comes down the pitch and gets an outside edge towards backward point
very short, Anderson calmly punches it to deep cover
just out of the reach of Raina's left hand as the batsman gets a leading edge
he plays a reverse sweep but makes no contact.. He was nowhere near the pitch of the delivery, it was delivered from way behind the popping crease
fired full on the stumps, the batsman can only dig it out back to the bowler
short delivery this time and he looks to play the ramp shot, but makes no contact. Too quick for him
full and that hits the middle! The batsman was making room and was swinging across the line.. Third wicket for Shami

inn2.comm: full on middle, hint of shape, defended towards mid-off
full at off stump, Rahane pushes it to the off side and Anderson fields it himself
drags the length back, outside off, left alone
full outside off, no huge movement for Anderson, left alone to Buttler
shorter and a touch wider outside off, gives Rahane the chance to cut and it travels to third man who is stationed quite wide
full at middle and off, dug out to the on side
pushed across outside off, on a full length, left alone
beats the edge as Rahane drives without really moving his feet, the ball angled across him
drives again, it slices in the air behind point but there's no one catching in the gully area
short of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
he opens the face a touch this time and steers down to third man
that's a good one! Touch of extra bounce around off stump and it slides past Rahane's edge on the angle
full outside off, he goes for the drive but is reaching for the ball and doesn't time it, the ball trickles to mid-on as the face closes
full and outside off, left alone
short of a length, going across the left hander, Dhawan shoulders arms
a strangled appeal for lbw from behind the wicket, but nothing from Anderson. This nipped back into Dhawan and it was squeezed off inside edge
across onto off stump, defended to the bowler
a little fuller this time, 87mph, gets forward and defends to the covers
full outside off, driven sweetly off the front foot but straight to Woakes at mid-off
shorter of length, on middle and leg, Rahane aims to work into the leg side and it takes a leading edge towards point
lets this one go through outside off
good delivery, 85mph, going across Rahane and he defends with an open face and the ball travels towards the fourth slip/fine gully
dropped in short, 87mph, but the pull picks out midwicket
on leg stump, turned off the pads to long leg
lovely stroke, picked up from around off stump, a full delivery, and whipped over straight midwicket with a late flick of the wrists
this time it's a poor delivery, drifting into the pads and clipped away in front of square
adjust his line, gets back outside off, defended on the front foot
now he drives off the front foot, threads the gap wide of short cover and then it beats mid-off...lovely timing. Classy
he's toying with Anderson, takes another straight delivery through midwicket with a turn of the wrists
on off stump, defended into the covers...that's kick-started India
angled into leg stump, takes the pad as Dhawan tries to turn it away
this time he middles it, was a fraction fuller and Dhawan clipped it firmly through square leg...was at the boundary in a flash
shifts to outside off, given into the pitch and it runs to the covers
short of a length, he gets inside the line and works it down to long leg
full on middle and off, Rahane walks into a defensive push which is well-timed to mid-off
shoved down the leg side, Rahane misses his flick
the face closes on this as he goes to drive, means he loses some timing as the ball runs straight of mid-off
short of a length on middle and leg, worked into the leg side
back of a length outside off, chopped into the pitch and it bobbles to the off side. Quick call for the single. Morgan's pick-up from point wasn't clean, but the batsman was safe anyway
short around leg stump, 85mph, pulled to long leg
full outside off, left alone
top shot. Perfect. He eases a full delivery on off stump down the ground with just a push. He times the ball so sweetly
defended into the off side, for a moment he thought of a single but was rightly sent back
now it's Dhawan's turn, leans into a delivery on off stump and rifles it (not Paul) past mid-off...didn't try to over-hit which was the key for him, just placement and timing
down the leg side, glances the thigh pad on the way to Buttler
short of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to cover
short again, he swivels nicely on his back foot and pulls to long leg
better delivery on middle and off, but that's excellent batting as he drops it towards mid-off and judges the chance of the run perfectly
very full at the stumps, flicked straight to midwicket
short of a length outside off, he rocks back and cuts to point
fuller on middle and off, another ball zings off Rahane's bat as he defends towards mid-on
gets across his crease and defends into the covers
played off the back foot again, waits for it and opens the face to drive square to point
latches onto the pull, connected sweetly but it wasn't a million miles from Moeen at square leg although short really isn't the way to go on this pitch
gets forward on off stump, defended off the thick outer part of the bat to point
starts full at leg stump, flicked over square leg...a freebie for Dhawan
now he over-corrects, drops short outside off and it's carved away through square cover
fuller this time, outside off, driven back to the bowler
straighter line, defended and it rolls behind
over the leg side again, a full delivery flicked deliberately in the air and placed wide of the man on the leg-side boundary. Poor line
short of a length outside off, chopped into the covers.
a bouncer which he ducks underneath, Reiffel checks with square leg about the height but it's just permissible
short of a length, nips back at Rahane who is jumping in the crease and gets taken high on the thigh pad
angled into the pads, deflects into square leg
short of a length on leg stump, takes the body down towards long leg
outside off, too short, defended towards point
another short delivery, he calmly rolls his wrists and sends it to long leg...not enough in the batsman's half, threatening the outside edge
nearly a wicket first ball? No, it was off the pad. A straight delivery which Rahane went to tickle away and it skimmed past the leg slip to his right
round the wicket, low full toss, driven back to the bowler
gets the length right, defended on the front foot to cover
uses his feet and flicks it towards mid-on
down the pitch again, driven down the ground to long-off
adjusts his length at the last moment as he saw Rahane using his feet, good bowling but he is able to adjust and flick it to deep square
short of a length, worked away into square leg
full on off stump, he gets forward and drives to cover
another gem of a drive, superb timing, full on middle and he just leans into a forward push which whistles straight down the ground
more effort on this one, 87mph, banged into the pitch and Dhawan looks awkward as he fends at it with his gloves but the ball goes straight to ground
defends a short-of-a-length delivery into the off side
now he goes fuller, and Dhawan's response is a good one as he drives fluently but Moeen dives to his right at mid-off to make a one-handed save
comes down the pitch and flicks down to long-on
round the wicket, whipped out to deep square-leg
full outside off, pushed into the covers
works a straight delivery through the leg side
floated outside off, he opens the face and places it to the cover sweeper
some decent turn, but it was a fraction short which allowed Rahane to play it off the back foot to long-on
driven neatly off the back foot to cover
fuller, punched towards mid-off
short of a length, angling towards leg stump and turned away off his body
round the wicket, full on off stump, flicked with plenty of bottom hand through the leg side
bouncer over middle and leg, Rahane just ignores it. Too short.
full on off stump, defended to the covers
short and hammered away, a front-foot pull in front of square and it travels all the way. That's as dismissive as it comes
he comes down the pitch and pushes it softly towards mid-on for a quick single
he waits on the back foot before punching it to deep extra cover
he comes forward and defends this one to midwicket
comes down the pitch too early. The bowler slows it down and Dhawan has to defend to off
another quick single to mid-on as Dhawan pushes it with soft hands
he waits on the back foot and whips it with the turn to deep midwicket
back of length just outside off, Rahane dabs it down towards point
he stays back and punches the length delivery back to the bowler
ooh.. he punches this towards mid-on and it was briefly in the air. Travels too quickly to the fielder
walks across to clip this to the leg side but misses, gets hit high on the thigh pad
he comes forward and solidly defends this length delivery down the pitch
comes forward and pushes this to mid-on with soft hands to keep strike
he gets to his half-century in style! Tossed up outside off and Rahane slog sweeps it a long long way over the rope.. Doesn't even extend his arms fully for that shot.. more timing than power
more runs, this one is flicked fine, fine enough to beat the short fine leg fielder. Moeen had fired this one a bit quicker
flatter and shorter, punched to mid-on
tossed up delivery outside off, eased to deep cover and that single brings the team's 100. It's been ages since India put up such a strong opening stand
he flicks this one to short fine leg
short and wide, the batsman waits and pushes it to deep cover for a single
length delivery on the stumps, easily defended to cover
on the pads this time and he whips it away, straight to midwicket though
marginally short but this is comfortably pulled to Ballance at deep midwicket

ohh la la! What timing! He comes down the pitch and whacks it over wide long on for yet another six. That clears the rope by a few inches. What is noticeable is the lack of power in these shots, but they just fly
looks to pull this but gets a bottom edge to the leg side
he waits on the back foot and dabs it in front of cover point for a quick single
no respect for spinner anymore.. Dhawan charges down and whacks it over mid-on for four more
he comes forward and defends it this time
pushes it with soft hands to cover point but is not interested in the single
he comes forward and defends this one to cover
comes out of the crease and works it away to deep midwicket for a couple
he gets a leading edge through cover for a single! The idea was to play it to midwicket but he closed the bat face too early
he opens the face to push it through the off but cannot beat point
he comes forward and punches this to deep cover for another easy single
looks for the big hit by charging down the pitch but gets more of an inside edge to the cow corner.. good enough for a couple
he is squared up a touch by this length delivery but is able to run it down to third man
length delivery on the stumps, dabbed to midwicket for a single
massive hit! This is into the stands.. Dhawan has fifty after an era of suffering in the dungeons.. He swings this length delivery and that is as high as long
fuller on the stumps, driven to mid on
more runs! He uses his feet and chips it over the bowler's head.. This sails and sails and is over the boundary
he comes forward and defends the tossed up delivery to the off side
punches this to mid-off from the back foot
waits on the back foot and cuts this away to deep point
comes down the pitch but defends this one to the leg side
short of length delivery, tucked away to fine leg off his hips
attempts a wide yorker, Dhawan tries to slide it fine through the off side but the short third man cuts it off
waits for the shortish delivery and cracks it off the back foot but is not able to beat backward point
looks to run this down fine on the off side but gets beaten, it was a slower one
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman whips it to midwicket
short delivery, Dhawan arches back and ramps it to third man for just a single
he comes down the pitch and drives it to long on for a single
he comes forward and punches the flighted delivery to cover
he waits on the back foot and punches it to long on for a single
full and on the stumps, punched down to long on
he comes down the pitch, but this turns and lobs up for the keeper off the pads
tossed up, flicked to deep midwicket easily
length delivery on the stumps, this is dabbed behind square on the leg side for another easy couple. This is becoming all too easy
wanted to go long but seeing the length is not there, checks his shot.. pushes it to cover

he takes a couple of steps down the pitch, makes room and flat-bats it down the ground for yet another disdainful hit.. This is now India's best opening stand outside the subcontinent in last five years
short ball, but Rahane is already on the front foot and he pulls it towards the cow corner anyway.. This is more of a top edge but there is no one in the deep ..
another couple! This is just a dab through backward square leg.. They are running away at some pace, these two
fuller delivery, he leans languidly on this one and punches it straight to mid off
short of length outside off, the batsman cuts it down to third man
he comes forward and punches this to cover.. straight to the fielder
Rahane is beaten! That was the slower one and passes the outside edge.. Rahane was through with his shot when the ball arrived
oh smart one now! He moves on to his best ODI score with a ramp shot to the third man boundary
this is just back of length and Rahane again tries to find that boundary fine on off side with a late cut, but this time third man cuts it off
he waits on the back foot and defends the length delivery to poiint
length ball, this is effortless punched down the ground for yet another couple
stays in the pitch and punches this one to deep cover for a single. What more, Gurney has overstepped
whoaa!! Massive massive hit.. This is slogged across the line with all the power that Rahane did not show.. Drags it over midwicket and this deep into the stands.. Smokingg..
he waits an extra second and runs this down to third man
length delivery on the stumps, defended to the off side
length delivery, easily pushed to cover for a single

he walks well outside off very very early and ramps it fine on the leg side.. Dhawan's confidence is back.. although a bit too late.. but he will take it I guess after what he has gone through this summer
length delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to cover
he comes forward and punches this down to long on for another single
he comes forward and defends this back-of-the-hand slower ball to cover
he comes forward and pushes this to point
he is going for the couple to fine leg and he gets to his first century in ODIs! What an innings.. that really caps up a solid season for him. Superb innings.
now picks up a quick single with a dab to point
he floats it up and Rahane smokes it over cover without any followthrough of the bat, another effortless shot
fuller outside off, he flicks it to long on for a single
full and he wants to crash it down the ground, but hit to mid on

oh no, he smokes the difficult ones all over the ground and when he gets an easy one, hits it straight to the fielder at cover point. It was a low full toss outside off and the batsman slices it to the fielder.. A soft end to an exciting innings
length delivery on the stumps, he defends it to the leg side
he stays on the back foot and defends it down the pitch
four more for Dhawan.. He comes down the pitch and whips it over midwicket for a one-bounce four..
spears this one on the block hole but it's blocked out fairly easily
he stays in the crease and clips it off the pads to deep backward square leg for a single
he picks up the slower delivery and drags it over midwicket for another boundary. Dhawan has arrived to the party.. a bit too late.. but he is hitting them well now
whoa!! This one clears the rope at wide long-on.. Dhawan has a train to catch.. he is in a hurry. Just stands tall and smokes the length delivery over the boundary
gets a yorker and it's dug out to cover point for a quick single. It brings up India's 200
now they make one into two.. The batsman pushes it to cover, calls for a quick single, then makes it into two as the bowler is unable to collect the throw cleanly
flat and hard, this is full and in the zone, thwacked over cover for four.. India are level with England
he has loved this day.. smokes a low full toss over mid-on with another flat hit and that travels all the way.
